title: Excel import on text classification project
body: Hi! I am trying to upload excel document to doccano set up in docker, but I am receiving this error: Not sure if this is something we are doing wrong, or anything environment related, or something else. Went over the code to try to find the issue and my first guess would be that xlsx file is recognized as zip file, but on the other hand `ENABLE_FILE_TYPE_CHECK` is set to False and I cannot find phrase `is not supported for read` anywhere in code base, so its most probably something else. Your Environment --------- Docker compose file (postgres is run as a separate docker instance): ``` # Note: Managed by Ansible services: doccano: image: doccano/doccano env_file: - .env environment: ADMIN_USERNAME: "${ADMIN_USERNAME}" ADMIN_PASSWORD: "${ADMIN_PASSWORD}" ADMIN_EMAIL: ${ADMIN_EMAIL} CELERY_BROKER_URL: "amqp://${RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_USER}:${RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_PASS}@rabbitmq" DATABASE_URL: "postgres://${POSTGRES_USER}:${POSTGRES_PASSWORD}@postgres:5432/${POSTGRES_DB}?sslmode=disable" ALLOW_SIGNUP: "False" DEBUG: "False" DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE: "config.settings.production" SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE: "True" CSRF_COOKIE_SECURE: "True" CSRF_TRUSTED_ORIGINS: "https://${DOCCANO_DOMAIN_NAME}" volumes: - ./media:/doccano/backend/media - ./static:/doccano/backend/staticfiles - ./tmp_file:/doccano/backend/filepond-temp-uploads networks: - default ports: - 8080:8080 - 8000:8000 depends_on: - celery celery: image: doccano/doccano env_file: - .env volumes: - ./media:/doccano/backend/media - ./tmp_file:/doccano/backend/filepond-temp-uploads entrypoint: ["celery", "--app=config", "worker", "--loglevel=info", "--pool=solo"] environment: PYTHONUNBUFFERED: "1" CELERY_BROKER_URL: "amqp://${RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_USER}:${RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_PASS}@rabbitmq" DATABASE_URL: "postgres://${POSTGRES_USER}:${POSTGRES_PASSWORD}@postgres:5432/${POSTGRES_DB}?sslmode=disable" DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE: "config.settings.production" networks: - default depends_on: - rabbitmq rabbitmq: image: rabbitmq:3.8-alpine env_file: - .env environment: RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_USER: "${RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_USER}" RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_PASS: "${RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_PASS}" networks: - default ports: - 5672:5672 networks: default: external: true name: linguistics_network ```
